# init(_:)

**Initializer**

Creates a custom vertical alignment of the specified type.

## Declaration

```swift
init(_ id: any AlignmentID.Type)
```

## Parameters

- **id**: The type of an identifier that uniquely identifies a vertical alignment.

## Discussion

Use this initializer to create a custom vertical alignment. Define an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AlignmentID] type, and then use that type to create a new static property on [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/VerticalAlignment]:

```swift
private struct FirstThirdAlignment: AlignmentID {
    static func defaultValue(in context: ViewDimensions) -> CGFloat {
        context.height / 3
    }
}

extension VerticalAlignment {
    static let firstThird = VerticalAlignment(FirstThirdAlignment.self)
}
```

Every vertical alignment instance that you create needs a unique identifier. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AlignmentID].

## Creating a custom alignment

- **combineExplicit(_:)**: Merges a sequence of explicit alignment values produced by this instance.
